Posts.Content: jpsp910 wrote: I had pet scan done and it said that I had hypermetabolic activity involving the left sacrum. It said patient is profoundly anemic, which I was not, had blood work, and because of this is most likely benign disease. However, early skeletal matastatic pathology cannot be excluded.  Everytime I ask my onc, they just do another test. What does this mean?  Please help, am at my witts end. I had dcis in 2006 and 35 rad treatments.  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 24, 2008 05:12PM jpsp910 wrote: They did pet to look for lung or colon ca mom has 2 primary cancers. They told me I couldn't be profoundly anemic and 7 days later without any meds not be anemic at all, dont understand.
